chinese: 谷仓很大，也很旧。
english: The barn was very large. It was very old.

chinese: 里面全是干草和粪肥的气味。
english: It smelled of hay and it smelled of manure.

chinese: 还有种跑累了的马身上的汗味儿与好脾气的母牛喷出的奇妙的香甜味道。
english: It smelled of the perspiration of tired horses and the wonderful sweet breath of patient cows.

chinese: 空气中常驻的，是一种和平的气息——好像这个世界上再不会有坏事情发生了。
english: It often had a sort of peaceful smell -- as though nothing bad could happen ever again in the world.

chinese: 这里偶尔还会有谷粒的香味，马具上的草料味，车子上的润滑油味，橡胶靴子味，或是新扎的草绳味儿。
english: It smelled of grain and of harness dressing and of axle grease and of rubber boots and of new rope.

chinese: 如果猫儿叼着人们扔给他的鱼头到这里来享受时，谷仓里就会多了股鱼腥味儿。
english: And whenever the cat was given a fish-head to eat, the barn would smell of fish.

chinese: 不过，这里面最浓的味道却是干草味儿，因为谷仓上面的大阁楼里总是堆满了干草。
english: But mostly it smelled of hay, for there was always hay in the great loft up overhead.

chinese: 这些干草被不断的扔给下面的母牛、马、绵羊们吃。
english: And there was always hay being pitched down to the cows and the horses and the sheep.

chinese: 冬天，当动物们在外面呆久了，回来后会觉得这个谷仓格外的温暖；而夏天呢，当谷仓的门大大敞开着，微风吹进来，这里又变得说不出的凉爽。
english: The barn was pleasantly warm in winter when the animals spent most of their time indoors, and it was pleasantly cool in summer when the big doors stood wide open to the breeze.

chinese: 谷仓上层面有马厩、牛棚，下层的地窖里是羊圈、威伯住的猪圈；里面还堆着你能从谷仓里找到的各类的器具：梯子，磨石，长柄草叉，活手搬子，大号的镰刀，割草机，清雪铲，斧子柄儿，牛奶桶，水桶，空粮食袋子，生锈的捕鼠夹等等。
english: The barn had stalls on the main floor for the work horses, tie-ups on the main floor for the cows, a sheep fold down below for the sheep, a pigpen down below for Wilbur, and it was full of all sorts of things that you find in barns: ladders, grind sones, pitch forks, monkey wrenches, scythes, lawn mowers, snow shovels, ax handles, milk pails, water buckets, empty grain sacks, and rusty rat traps.

chinese: 这是燕子们喜欢来筑巢的谷仓。
english: It was the kind of barn that swallows like to build their nests in.

chinese: 这是孩子们喜欢在里面玩耍的那种谷仓。
english: It was the kind of barn that children like to play in.

chinese: 这里的一切都是属于芬的舅舅，霍默·L·祖克曼先生的。
english: And the whole thing was owned by Fern's uncle, Mr.Homer L. Zuckerman.

chinese: 威伯的新家在谷仓的下层，正好在牛棚底下。
english: Wilbur's new home was in the lower part of the barn, directly underneath the cows.

chinese: 祖克曼先生知道牛粪堆是养小猪的好地方。
english: Mr.Zucherman knew that a manure pile is a good place to keep a young pig.

chinese: 猪喜欢温暖，而谷仓下朝南的地窖正是温暖而又舒适的地方。
english: Pigs need warmth, and it was warm and comfortable down there in the barn cellar on the south side.

chinese: 芬差不多每天都来看威伯。
english: Fern came almost every day to visit him.

chinese: 她找到一张没人要的挤奶凳，于是便把凳子搬到紧挨着威伯的猪圈的羊圈旁。
english: She found an old milking stool that had been discarded, and she placed the stool in the sheepfold next to Wilbur's pen.

chinese: 整个漫长的下午，她就这么静静地坐在那里，望着威伯，想着，听着。
english: Here she sat quietly during the long afternoons, thinking and listening and watching Wilbur.

chinese: 绵羊不久便认识她，并信任她了。
english: The sheep soon got to know her and trust her.

chinese: 和羊住在一起的母鹅也是。
english: So did the geese, who lived with sheep.

chinese: 所有的动物都信任她，因为她是那么的文静、和善。
english: All the animals trusted her, she was so quiet and friendly.

chinese: 祖克曼先生不让她把威伯带出去，也不让她进猪圈。
english: Mr.Zuckerman did not allow her to take Wilbur out, and he did not allow to git into the pigpen.

chinese: 不过，他告诉芬，如果她愿意，她坐在凳子上看威伯多久都行。
english: But he told Fern that she could sit on the stool and watch Wilbur as long as she wanted to.

chinese: 能靠近威伯她就感到很幸福了；知道芬就坐在他家的外面，威伯也感到无比的快活。
english: It made her happy just to be near the pig, and it made Wilbur happy to know that she was setting there, right outside his pen.

chinese: 只是他却再不能做从前的乐事了——不能再散步，不能再坐婴儿车，也不能再去游泳了。
english: But he never had any fun -- no walks, no reded, no swims.

chinese: 六月的一个下午，差不多两个月大的威伯游荡到他在谷仓外的院子里。
english: One afternoon in June, when Wilbur was almost two months old, he wandered out into his small yard outside the barn.

chinese: 那天芬没像往常一样来看他。
english: Fern had not arrived for her usual visit.

chinese: 站在阳光下的威伯，觉得孤单而又无聊。
english: Wilbur stood in the sun feeling lonely and bored.

chinese: “在这里从没任何事儿可做，”他想。
english: "There's never anything to do around here," he though.

chinese: 他慢慢地走到食槽前，用鼻子搜寻着，想找找是否有忘了吃的午餐。
english: He walked slowly to his food trough and sniffed to see if anything had been overlooked at lunch.

chinese: 他发现了一小截土豆皮，就把它吃了下去。
english: He found a small strip of potato skin and ate it.

chinese: 他感到背有点儿痒，就斜靠到栅栏上，在木板上使劲的蹭着。
english: His back itched, so he leaned against the fence and rubbed against the boards.

chinese: 当他蹭腻了，便走回他的家门口，爬到牛粪堆顶上，坐了下来。
english: When he tried of this, he walked indoors, climbed to the top of the manured pile, and sat down.

chinese: 他不想睡，也不想再乱拱了，他厌倦了再这么静静的傻站着，也厌倦了睡觉。
english: He didn't feel like going to sleep, he didn't feel like digging, he was tired of standing still, tired of lying down.

chinese: ”我才活了不到两个月，就对生活厌烦了，”他说。
english: "I'm less than two months old and I'm tired of living," he said.

chinese: 他又往院子里去了。
english: He walked out to the yard again.

chinese: “当我来到这儿，”他说，“除了回家没别的地方可去。当我进了家，除了院子也没别的地方可逛。”
english: "When I'm out here," he said, "there's no place to go but in. When I'm indoors, there's no place to go but out in the yard."

chinese: “你错了，我的朋友，我的朋友。”一个声音说。
english: "That's where you're wrong, my friend, my friend," said a voice.

chinese: 威伯往栅栏那边看去，发现一只母鹅就站在那里。
english: Wilbur looked through the fence and saw the goose standing there.

chinese: “你不用老呆在那个肮脏的-小 肮脏的-小 肮脏的-小院子里，”母鹅说得相当的快。
english: "You don't have to stay in that dirty-little dirty-little dirty-little yard ," said the goose, who talked rather fast.

chinese: “这儿有一块木板松了。推开它，推-推-推开它，就能够出去！”
english: "One of the boards in loose. Push on it, push-push-push on it, and come on out!"

chinese: “什么？”威伯说。“说慢一点儿！”
english: "What?" said Wilbur. "Say it slower!"

chinese: “让-让-让，让我冒险重复一遍，”母鹅说，“我的意思是，建议你跑出去。这外面的世界精彩极了。”
english: "At-at-at, at the risk of repeating myself," said the goose, "I suggest that you come on out. It's wonderful out here."

chinese: “你是说有块木板松了？”
english: "Did you say a board was loose?"

chinese: “那就是我要说的，那就是。”母鹅说。
english: "That I did, that I did," said the goose.

chinese: 威伯走到栅栏旁，发现母鹅说得对——真的有一块木板松了。
english: Wilbur walked up to the fence and saw that the goose was right -- one board was loose.

chinese: 他低下头，闭起眼，用力撞过去。
english: He put his head sown, shut his eyes, and pushed.

chinese: 木板松开了。
english: The board gave way.

chinese: 没用一分钟，他就挤过了栅栏，来到院子外的长草丛中了。
english: In a minute he had squeezed through the fence and was standing in the long grass outside his yard.

chinese: 母鹅嘎嘎大笑起来。
english: The goose chuckled.

chinese: “自由的滋味如何？”她问。
english: "How does it fell to be free?" she asked.

chinese: “我喜欢，”威伯说。“我的意思是说，我想我喜欢这感觉。”
english: "I like it," said Wilbur. "That is, I guess like it."

chinese: 实际上，当威伯站在栅栏外，望着这个与自己毫无阻隔的大大的世界的时候，他只有种梦幻般的，说不清的感觉。
english: Actually, Wilbur felt queer to be out side his fence, with nothing between him and the big world.

chinese: “你说我去哪儿比较好？”
english: "Where do you think I'd better go?"

chinese: “你喜欢的任何地方，你喜欢的任何地方，”母鹅说。
english: "Anywhere you like, anywhere you like," said the goose.

chinese: “到果园那里去，把路上的草皮翻出来！到花园去，把萝卜拱出来！拱开一切！吃草！找玉米粒儿！寻找燕麦！把一切都压倒！蹦高和跳舞，后脚立地跳起来！走过果园，去树林里漫步！在你年轻时世界是多么美妙。”
english: "Go down through the orchard, root up the sod! Go down through the garden, dig up the radishes! Root up everything! Eat grass! Look from corn! Look for oats! Run all over! Skip and dance, jump adn prance! Go down through the orchard and the stroll in the woods! The world is a wonderful place when you're young."

chinese: “我明白你的意思，”威伯回答。
english: "I can see that," replied Wilbur.

chinese: 他在空气中跳跃着，转了几个圈儿，又跑了几步，才停了下来，四处搜寻着，嗅着午后的气息，不久，他向果园走去。
english: He gave a jump in the air, twirled, ran a few steps, stopped, looked all around, sniffed the smells of afternoon, and then set off walking down through the orchard.

chinese: 他停到一棵苹果树荫下，把他强壮的鼻子插进土里，开始尽情地拱、挖、掘。
english: Pausing in the shade of an apple tree, he put his strong snout into the ground and began pushing, digging and rooting.

chinese: 他感到非常的快活。
english: He felt very happy.

chinese: 在有人注意到他之前，他已经掘起很多土了。
english: He had plowed up quiet a piece of ground before anyone notice him.

chinese: 祖克曼太太是第一个看见他的。
english: Mrs.Zuckerman was the first to see him.

chinese: 她从厨房的窗子里望见了他，便开始喊人。
english: She saw him from the kitchen window, and she immediately shouted for the men.

chinese: “霍——默！”她喊。
english: "Ho-mer!" she cried.

chinese: “猪跑出来了！鲁维！猪跑了！霍默！鲁维！猪跑了。他在那棵苹果树下面呢。”
english: "Pig's out! Lurvy! Pig's out! Homer! Lurvy! Pig's out. He's down there under that apple tree."

chinese: “现在麻烦来了，”威伯想。“现在我要被抓住了。”
english: "Now the trouble starts," through Wilbur. "Now I'll catch it."

chinese: 母鹅也听见了她的吵嚷，便对威伯大喊。
english: The goose heard the racket and she, too, started hollering.

chinese: “跑-跑-跑到下坡去，往树林里跑，树林！”她拼命地嚷。“他们在树林里永远-永远-永远抓不住你。”
english: "Run-run-run down hill, make for the woods, the woods!" she shouted to Wilbur."They'll never-never-never catch you in the woods."

chinese: 听到这场骚动的长毛狗从谷仓里跑出去追。
english: The cocker spaniel heard the commotion and he ran out from the barn to join the chase.

chinese: 祖克曼先生听到喊声，忙从工作间里跑出来，放下了手中正在修理的农具。
english: Mr.Zuckerman heard, and he came out of the machine shed where he was mending a tool.

chinese: 在龙须菜地里拔草的雇工鲁维，听到喊声，也赶紧跑了出来。
english: Lurvy, the hired man, heard the noise and came uo form the asparagus patch where he was pulling weeds.

chinese: 每个人都在朝威伯逼近！威伯不知所措了。
english: Everybody walked toward Wilbur and Wilbur didn't know what to do.

chinese: 到树林的路似乎是那么远，而且，他还从没进过树林，也不知道是否会喜欢呆在树林里呢。
english: The woods seemed a long way off, and anyway, he had never been down there in the woods and wasn't sure the would like it.

chinese: “绕到他身后去，鲁维，”祖克曼先生说，“把他朝谷仓这边赶！小心点儿——别吓坏他！我去拿一桶猪食来。”
english: "Get around behind him, Lurvy," said Mr.Zuckerman, "and drive him toward the barn! And take it easy-don't rush him! I'll go and get a bucket of slops."

chinese: 威伯逃跑的消息在这里的动物中间迅速传开了。
english: The news of Wilbur's escape spread rapidly among the animals on the place.

chinese: 以前从没有任何一只动物能逃离祖克曼先生的农场呢，因此这事情引起了大家极大的兴趣。
english: Whenever any creature broke loose on Zuckerman's farm, the event was of great interest to the others.

chinese: 母鹅对离她最近的母牛嚷道，威伯自由了，不久所有的母牛都知道了这个新闻。
english: The goose shouted to the nearest cow that Wilbur was free, and soon all the cows knew.

chinese: 然后一头母牛把这消息告诉了一只绵羊，不久所有的绵羊也知道了。
english: Then one of the cows told one of the sheep, and soon all the sheep knew.

chinese: 羊羔们又从他们的母亲那里了解了一切。
english: Then lambs learned about it from their mothers.

chinese: 谷仓的马厩里的马们，竖起的耳朵也听到了母鹅的喊叫，因此不久所有的马也明白发生了什么事儿。
english: The horses, in their stalls in the barn, picked up their ears when they heard the goose hollering; and soon the horses had caught on to what was happening.

chinese: “威伯逃了，”他们说。
english: "Wilbur's out", they said.

chinese: 每一个动物都兴奋地抬起头，变得分外的激动，因为他们知道他们的一个朋友已经获得了自由，再不用被紧紧的关在圈里了。
english: Every animals stirred and lifted its head and became excited to know that one of his friends had got free and was no longer penned up ot tied fast.

chinese: 威伯不知该怎么做，往哪里跑。
english: Wilbur didn't know what to do or which way to run.

chinese: 看起来好像每个人都在追他。
english: It seemed as through everybody was after him.

chinese: “如果这就是美好的自由，”他想，“我还不如被关在我自己的院子里呢。”
english: "If this is what it's like to be free," he though, "I believe I'd rather be penned up in my own yard."

chinese: 长毛狗从一边悄悄地靠过来。
english: The cocker spaniel was sneaking up on him from one side.

chinese: 雇工鲁维也正从另一边渐渐逼近。
english: Lurvy the hired man was sneaking up on him from the other side.

chinese: 祖克曼太太摆出了一副准备拦截的架势——如果威伯要往花园里跑的话。现在，祖克曼先生拎着桶正朝威伯走过来。
english: Mrs.Zuckerman stood ready to head him off if he started for the garden, and now Mr.Zuckerman was coming down toward him carrying a pail.

chinese: “这真太可怕了，”威伯想。
english: "This is really awful", though Wilbur.

chinese: “为什么芬还不来？”他开始哭了。
english: "Why doesn't Fern come?" He began to cry.

chinese: 母鹅给威伯发出一个又一个指令。
english: The goose took command and began to give orders.

chinese: “别傻站着，威伯！快逃，快逃！”母鹅大叫。
english: "Don't just stand there, Wilbur! Dodge about, dodge about!" cried the goose.

chinese: “转圈跳，往我这边儿跳，溜过来冲出去，过来出去，过来出去！往树林跑！迂回前进！”
english: "Skip around, run toward me, slip in and out, in and out, in and out! Make for the woods! Twist and turn!"

chinese: 长毛狗猛地蹿起来咬向威伯的后腿。
english: The cocker spaniel sprang for Wilbur's hind leg.

chinese: 威伯蹦着高儿跑开。
english: Wilbur jumped and ran.

chinese: 鲁维冲上前去抓威伯。
english: Lurvy reached out and grabbed.

chinese: 祖克曼太太对鲁维尖叫起来。
english: Mrs.Zuckerman screamed at Lurvy.

chinese: 母鹅还在为威伯加油。
english: The goose cheered for Wilbur.

chinese: 威伯从鲁维的双腿间逃了出去。
english: Wilbur dodged between Lurvy's legs.

chinese: 鲁维没有抓到威伯，反一把搂住了长毛狗。
english: Lurvy missed Wilbur and grabbed the spaniel instead.

chinese: “干得好，干得好！”母鹅叫道。“再来一个，再来一个！”
english: "Nicely done, nicely done!" cried the goose. "Try it again, try it again!"

chinese: “往下坡跑！”母牛们出主意。
english: "Run downhill!" suggested the cows.

chinese: “向我这里跑！”公鹅尖叫。
english: "Run toward me!" yelled the gander.

chinese: “往上坡跑！”绵羊大喊。
english: "Run uphill!" cried the sheep.

chinese: “迂回前进！”母鹅嘎嘎地叫着。
english: "Turn and twist!" honked the goose.

chinese: “跳，蹦高儿！”公鸡叫。
english: "Jump and dance!" said the rooster.

chinese: “小心鲁维！”母牛提醒。
english: "Look out for Lurvy!" called the cows.

chinese: “小心祖克曼！”公鹅扯着嗓子喊。
english: "Look out for Zuckerman!" yelled the gander.

chinese: “小心那条狗！”绵羊大叫。
english: "Watch out for the dog!" cried the sheep.

chinese: “听我的，听我的！”母鹅尖叫。
english: "Listen to me, listen to me!" screamed the goose.

chinese: 可怜的威伯被他们的乱叫弄得又晕又怕。
english: Poor Wilbur was dazed and frightened by this hullabaloo.

chinese: 他可不喜欢成为这些乱子的焦点。
english: He didn't like being the center of all this fuss.

chinese: 他本想试着听从朋友们给他的建议，可他不能同时既往上坡跑，又往下坡跑，而且，他也不能一边蹦起来一边迂回前进，更何况他哭喊得这么厉害，几乎弄不清周围都发生了什么事。
english: He tried to follow the instruction his friends were giving him, but he couldn't run downhill and uphill at the same time, and he couldn't turn and twist when he was jumping and dancing, and he was crying so hard he could barely see anything that was happening.

chinese: 真的，威伯毕竟只不过是一头比婴儿大不多少的小猪罢了。
english: After all, Wilbur was a very young pig-not much more than a baby, really.

chinese: 他只希望芬此刻在场，能把自己抱起来安慰一番。
english: He wished Fern were there to take him in his arms and comfort him.

chinese: 当他抬头看到祖克曼先生就静静地站在身旁，手里拎着盛满热乎乎的稀饭的食桶时，才稍稍宽了心。
english: When he looked up and saw Mr.Zuckerman standing quite close to him, holding a pail fo warm slops, he felt relieved.

chinese: 他耸起鼻子使劲儿闻着。
english: He lifted his nose and sniffed.

chinese: 那些味道多鲜美呀——有热牛奶，土豆皮，粗麦粉，凯洛格牌玉米片，还有祖克曼先生早餐吃剩的酥饼呢。
english: The smelled was delicious-warm milk, potato skins, wheat middlings, Kellogg's Corn Flakes, and a popover left from the Zuckerman's breakfast.

chinese: “来呀，小猪！”祖克曼先生说着，敲了敲食桶。“来呀，小猪！”
english: "Come, pig!" said Mr.Zuckerman, tapping the pail. "Come pig!"

chinese: 威伯朝那只桶走了一步。
english: Wilbur took a step toward the pail.

chinese: “不——不——不！”母鹅说。“这桶是个并不新鲜的骗局，威伯。别上套儿！别上套儿！他是想以此诱捕你。他正在用好吃的诱惑你的肚子。”
english: "No-no-no!" said the goose. "It's the old pail trick, Wilbur. Don't fall for it, don't fall for it! He's trying to lure you back into captivity-ivity. He's appealing to your stomach."

chinese: 威伯不在乎。
english: Wilbur didn't care.

chinese: 这食物闻起来太开胃了。
english: The food smelled appetizing.

chinese: 他又朝食桶走了一步。
english: He took another step toward the pail.

chinese: “小猪，小猪！”祖克曼先生甜蜜地叫着，开始慢慢地往谷仓方向走，同时弄出一副纯真的表情回头看着，好像他不知道这头小白猪正跟在他后面走一样。
english: "Pig, pig!" said Mr.Zuckerman in a kind voice, and began walking slowly toward the barnyard, looking all about him innocently, as if he didn't know that a little white pig was following along behind him.

chinese: “你会后悔-后悔-后悔的。”母鹅叫道。
english: "You'll be sorry-sorry-sorry," called the goose.

chinese: 他还在朝食桶走。
english: He kept walking toward the pail of slops.

chinese: “你会失去你的自由的，”母鹅大喊。“一小时的自由要比一大桶猪食更可贵！”
english: "You'll miss your freedom," honked the goose. "An hour of freedom is worth a barrel of slops."

chinese: 威伯还是不在乎。
english: Wilbur didn't care.

chinese: 祖克曼先生走到猪圈附近，便爬过栅栏，把猪食倒进了猪食槽。
english: When Mr. Zuckerman reached the pigpen, he climbed over the fence and poured the slops into the trough.

chinese: 然后他把那块松动的木板从栅栏上全拽下来，好让威伯能很容易的进去。
english: Then he pulled the loose board away from the fence, so that there was a wide hole for Wilbur to walk through.

chinese: “再想想，再想想！”母鹅提醒道。
english: "Reconsider, reconsider!" cried the goose.

chinese: 威伯什么别的也没想。
english: Wilbur paid no attention.

chinese: 他一步步走进栅栏，到了他的院子里。
english: He stepped through the fence into his yard.

chinese: 他走向食槽，吸食了半天，大口大口地喝着牛奶，嚼着酥饼。
english: He walked to the trough and took a long drink of slops, sucking in the milk hungrily and chewing the popover.

chinese: 能再回家真是太好了。
english: It was good to be home again.

chinese: 就在威伯饱餐之际，鲁维取了把锤子和一些八分长的钉子来，把那块板子钉了回去。
english: While Wilbur ate, Lurvy fetched a hammer and some 8-penny nails and nailed the board in place.

chinese: 然后，他和祖克曼先生懒洋洋地倚在栅栏旁。祖克曼先生用一根柴枝搔着威伯的后背。
english: Then he and Mr. Zuckerman leaned lazily on the fence and Mr. Zuckerman scratched Wilbur's back with a stick.

chinese: “他真是一头猪，”鲁维说。
english: "He's quite a pig," said Lurvy.

chinese: “是的，他会成为一头好猪的，”祖克曼先生说。
english: "Yes, he'll make a good pig," said Mr. Zuckerman.

chinese: 威伯听到了对他的赞扬。
english: Wilbur heard the words of praise.

chinese: 他感到肚子里的牛奶暖暖的。
english: He felt the warm milk inside his stomach.

chinese: 他也很愿意在那根柴枝上蹭痒。
english: He felt the pleasant rubbing of the stick along his itchy back.

chinese: 他既幸福又满足，想去睡一觉了。
english: He felt peaceful and happy and sleepy.

chinese: 这真是一个令人疲倦的下午。
english: This had been a tiring afternoon.

chinese: 。虽然此刻只不过才四点钟，威伯却准备上床就寝了。
english: It was still only about four o'clock but Wilbur was ready for bed.

chinese: “我真的太年轻，还不适合一个人在这世上闯，” 躺下时他这么想。
english: "I'm really too young to go out into the world alone," he thought as he lay down.
